alert.note: Alert for Southern Meade Co Plains (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 11:58AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Meade County through 1245 PM MDT... At 1158 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Viewfield, or 18 miles northeast of Rapid City, moving east-northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Viewfield around 1205 PM MDT. Curlew Lake around 1210 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Elm Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
